scripts.start: npm run sass && concurrently "npm run sass:watch" "react-scripts start"
scripts.Comment-B: We could have used the above aproach for SASS compiling, but newly created files wont be compiled by watcher (need restart)
scripts.Comment-C: The drawback with the approach we currently use is however that ALL SASS files gets compiled if ONE changes
scripts.Comment-D: I See that the documentation has updated to use node-sass-chokidar now, that should fix the problem with detecting new files -- need to test it ofcourse
scripts.Comment-E: onchange also always exits with code 1 for CTRL C, maybe node-sass-chokidar dont do that?
scripts.Comment-F: React build job does not strip console nor debugger, hard to do for us on the hashed js file(?)
